data.title: About the Department
description: The department was established with an undergraduate programme in Computer Science and Engineering (Cyber Security) in 2020. This is a specialization branch of Computer Science and Engineering in which students get the technical knowledge in the Computer Science and Engineering, Cyber Security, Digital Forensic and emerging areas such as Device Security and Forensics. The department is well equipped with laboratories like Cryptography Lab, Network Security Lab, Internet and Web Application Security Lab, Ethical Hacking Lab, Vulnerability Assessment and Penetration Testing Lab, Malware Analysis, Secure Coding Lab, Cyber Forensics and Digital Forensics lab.

content: The department has well-experienced and highly-motivated faculty members and their major areas include Networking and network Security, Ethical hacking, Web Application Security, Penetration Testing, Malware analysis and Cyber Forensics. The faculty members impart their knowledge and skills to the students to achieve the goals of the department.

The faculty members are encouraged to publish articles in national and international journals. The Department has signed MoUs with leading industries and organizations for establishing collaborative research, conducting Workshops, Seminars and for organizing International Conferences. Professional association CyberWatch Center is developed for professional interaction.

content.title: Our Vision
content.description: To develop technically cyber skilled professionals by imparting state-of-art innovative, multi-disciplinary teams to address contemporary and future cyber security through innovative and flexible environment.

item: To educate and train the budding engineers in the field of Cyber Security and cyber forensics in academia and industry.
To establish Centre of Research in Cyber Security and Cyber Forensics to address the technical challenges.
To enhance the entrepreneurship skills by providing training through Industry Institute Interaction and government program.

content.description: Graduates will be able to comprehend mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, laboratory and work-based experiences to formulate and solve problems related to the domain of Cyber Security, Cyber Forensics and develop proficiency in computer based engineering and the use of computation tools.
Graduates will be prepared to communicate and work effectively on the multidisciplinary engineering projects practicing the ethics of their profession with a sense of social responsibility.
Graduates will recognize the importance of lifelong learning to become experts both as entrepreneurs or employees and to extend their knowledge in their domain.

content.title: The engineer and society

content.title: Environment and sustainability
content.description: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.
